Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Okay, lets tackle this Procure-to-Pay (P2P) event log analysis. I need to look at each case and see if the sequence of activities makes sense according to standard P2P. Let me recall the typical P2P steps first. Standard P2P process usually goes like this: 1. Create Purchase Requisition (PR) - someone requests goodsservices. 2. Approve PR - manager or authorized person approves the requisition. 3. Issue Purchase Order (PO) - after approval, the PO is sent to the vendor. 4. Receive Goods - once the vendor delivers, the goods are received and checked. 5. Vendor Invoice Received - the vendor sends an invoice. 6. Match Invoice to PO - matching the invoice with the PO and the goods receipt (three-way match: PO, invoice, goods receipt). 7. Release Payment - after matching, payment is processed. 8. Close Case - final step. There might be variations, but generally, you cant receive goods before issuing a PO. Also, you cant match invoice to PO before receiving the goods or having the invoice. Lets check each case.
